thread.title: Collison's 18 points lead Kings to 94-90 preseason win
thread.title_full: Collison's 18 points lead Kings to 94-90 preseason win

title: Collison's 18 points lead Kings to 94-90 preseason win
text:
Close Image 1 of 4 
Sacramento Kings center DeMarcus Cousins, left, keeps the ball out of the reach of Portland Trail Blazers center Mason Plumlee during the first quarter of an NBA basketball game in Sacramento, Calif., Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Photo: Rich Pedroncelli, AP Sacramento Kings center DeMarcus Cousins, left, keeps the ball out... Image 2 of 4 
Portland Trail Blazers guard Allen Crabbe goes up to stuff against the Sacramento Kings during the first quarter of an NBA basketball game in Sacramento, Calif., Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Photo: Rich Pedroncelli, AP Portland Trail Blazers guard Allen Crabbe goes up to stuff against... Image 3 of 4 
Portland Trail Blazers center Mason Plumlee, center, tries to drive between Sacramento Kings' Willie Cauley-Stein, left, and DeMarcus Cousins during the first quarter of an NBA basketball game in Sacramento, Calif., Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Photo: Rich Pedroncelli, AP Portland Trail Blazers center Mason Plumlee, center, tries to drive... Image 4 of 4 
Portland Trail Blazers forward Meyers Leonard (11) goes to the basket past Sacramento Kings guard Darren Collison during the first quarter of an NBA basketball game in Sacramento, Calif., Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. Photo: Rich Pedroncelli, AP Portland Trail Blazers forward Meyers Leonard (11) goes to the... Collison's 18 points lead Kings to 94-90 preseason win 1 / 4 Back to Gallery SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) â€” Darren Collison scored 18 points and DeMarcus Cousins had 16 to lead the Sacramento Kings to as 94-90 preseason victory over the Portland Trail Blazers on Saturday night. The Kings ran off 12 straight points in the fourth quarter and held Portland scoreless for more than 5 minutes in taking a 91-84 lead. CJ McCollum hit five 3-pointers and scored 19 of 30 points in the third quarter for Portland, which has lost to Sacramento twice in six days. BLAZERS: Allen Crabbe fouled out midway through the fourth quarter and had 13 points and Al-Farouq Aminu had 12. Pat Connaughton collected 11 rebounds and starting center Mason Plumlee went scoreless in 22 minutes. A sore left hip has prevented veteran guard Gerald Henderson from playing any preseason games. KINGS: Marco Bellinelli had 11 points and Omri Casspi had 10. Reserve Seth Curry played point guard the entire final quarter and scored all six of his points in the fourth. Rookie Willie Cauley-Stein had seven points and nine rebounds. STAR WATCH: Rudy Gay , the Kings' second-leading scorer in the preseason, was given the night off. Portland played without all-star point guard Damian Lillard , who sprained his left ankle Thursday in a win over Golden State. Lillard has never missed a regular season game in three seasons. BALL CONTROL: The Kings had a season-low 13 turnovers after committing 21 or more in their first three games. The Blazers were sloppy for much of the game and had 21 turnovers, including six by Aminu and four by Plumlee. UP NEXT: The Blazers visit Utah on Monday. The Kings face the Lakers on Tuesday in Las Vegas. Southeast Texas sports news
